sub_topic: Probability of a certain outcome in a sports game
message_1: In a football match between team A and team B, the probability of team A winning is 2/5 and the probability of a draw is 1/5. What is the probability of team B winning the match?
message_2:
The sum of the probabilities of all possible outcomes (team A winning, team B winning, and a draw) must equal 1. Let P(B) be the probability of team B winning the match. We can set up the equation:

P(A) + P(B) + P(draw) = 1

Substitute the given probabilities:

(2/5) + P(B) + (1/5) = 1

Combine the fractions:

(3/5) + P(B) = 1

Now, subtract (3/5) from both sides of the equation to solve for P(B):

P(B) = 1 - (3/5)

P(B) = (5/5) - (3/5)

P(B) = 2/5

So, the probability of team B winning the match is 2/5.
